title: How to Use a Crockpot for an Easy One Pot Soup Dinner

steps.headline: Empty the cans of broth and mushrooms (include the liquid) into the Crock Pot.
Drain the split peas and add.
Place the onion on top of the peas.
Place the  boneless chuck steak on top.
steps.description: Do not place it directly on the bottom. A Crockpot cooks from the sides of a pot and not the bottom. Chuck steak is a flat cut, and  usually a tough piece of meat. When cooked for 8 hours however, it literally falls apart and is tasty and soft.

steps.headline: Separate the 4 chunks of potato and place on each side of the steak.
Add some salt and pepper to taste and sprinkle paprika over the potatoes for color.
Set the Crockpot on low for at least 7-8 hours.
Add the frozen bag of veggies for the last hour.
steps.description: It does not matter if the veggies cook a bit longer so the timing does not have to be exact.

text: Empty the cans of broth and mushrooms (include the liquid) into the Crock Pot.  Drain the split peas and add.  Place the onion on top of the peas.  Place the  boneless chuck steak on top. Do not place it directly on the bottom. A Crockpot cooks from the sides of a pot and not the bottom. Chuck steak is a flat cut, and  usually a tough piece of meat. When cooked for 8 hours however, it literally falls apart and is tasty and soft. Separate the 4 chunks of potato and place on each side of the steak.  Add some salt and pepper to taste and sprinkle paprika over the potatoes for color.  Set the Crockpot on low for at least 7-8 hours.  Add the frozen bag of veggies for the last hour. It does not matter if the veggies cook a bit longer so the timing does not have to be exact.
